title: Wrangell - St Elias National Park & Preserve: Photo Gallery
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Photo Gallery               Photo Gallery        Midnight light on Mount Wrangell        It has been said that a picture is worth a thousand words. The following pages explore some of the many natural and cultural resources which make Wrangell-St. Elias National Park & Preserve unique.  Visitor Photo Gallery If you have taken any high quality, high resolution images which you would like to submit for inclusion in our Visitor Photo Gallery, we welcome your interest and submissions. While we can not guarantee that every image we receive will be included, we would like to consider yours.           Flickr Photo Gallery  For more scenic photos of Wrangell-St. Elias, including high resolution images, please visit the park's Flickr Website.                 Airplanes   13 Photos  With vast distances measured in hundreds of miles, flying is the best way to not only see but also access Wrangell-St. Elias National Park.          Birds of the Wrangells   22 Photos  Photos of Wrangell-St. Elias Birds          Coast and Ocean   3 Photos  Wrangell-St. Elias contains more than 75 miles of coastline along the Gulf of Alaska.            Glaciers   38 Photos  Glacial ice covers 1/3 of Wrangell-St. Elias National Park and Preserve.  That is an area equal to TWO Yellowstone National Parks!          Jökulhlaup   10 Photos  Wrangell-St. Elias has several glacial lakes that empty every year and then refill.  The glacial outburst floods from these lakes are examples of Jökulhlaups, an Icelandic term that literally translates to "glacier run."          Kennecott Mines National Historic Landmark   9 Photos  Kennecott Mines National Historic Landmark is located within Wrangell-St. Elias National Park.  This landmark contains several copper ore mines and the mill town that was used to extract the copper from the ore.  The Kennecott Corporation established and managed this area during the early 1900s.            Mammals of Wrangell-St. Elias   5 Photos  Ranging from the enormous humpback whale in the ocean depths to the tiny pika living on mountaintops, Wrangell-St. Elias National park has a great diversity of mammal life.           McCarthy Road   8 Photos            Mountains & Ridges- Other   7 Photos  Wrangell-St. Elias contains 521 peaks over two thousand feet high that have at least one thousand feet of drop surrounding them!            Mountains- St. Elias Range   7 Photos  Stretching over 300 miles in length, the St. Elias Mountains reach 19,000 feet in elevation and is considered the highest coastal mountain range on the planet.
